entity1.name: Cooking
entity1.description: A method of preparing food for consumption, involving various chemical changes and interactions.

entity2.name: Chemical Reaction
entity2.description: A process where substances are transformed into different substances through the breaking and forming of chemical bonds.

entity3.name: chemistry of cooking
entity3.description: The scientific principles and processes involved in the preparation of food, affecting its taste, texture, and nutritional value.

entity4.name: Maillard reaction
entity4.description: A chemical reaction between amino acids and reducing sugars that occurs when food is cooked, leading to the browning of foods and the development of complex flavors.

entity5.name: emulsification
entity5.description: A process where two immiscible substances (such as oil and water) are combined to form a stable mixture, often used in cooking to create sauces and dressings.

entity6.name: Maillard reaction
entity6.description: A chemical reaction between amino acids and reducing sugars that occurs when food is cooked, baked, or grilled, contributing to flavor and color.

entity7.name: proteins

entity8.name: sugars
entity8.description: Simple carbohydrates that are the building blocks of more complex carbohydrates.

entity9.name: heat

entity13.name: roasted meats

entity20.name: Emulsions

entity62.name: alcohol

entity63.name: carbon dioxide
entity63.description: A colorless and odorless gas composed of one carbon atom and two oxygen atoms, often a byproduct of cellular respiration and fermentation.

entity64.name: Pickling
entity64.description: A food preservation method that involves storing food in a brine solution to prevent the growth of microorganisms that cause spoilage.

entity65.description: A concentrated solution of salt and water, often used in pickling to preserve food by inhibiting microbial growth.
